104TH GENERAL ASSEMBLY

State of Illinois

2025 and 2026

SB2398

Introduced 2/7/2025, by Sen. Bill Cunningham

SYNOPSIS AS INTRODUCED:

230 ILCS 45/25-63 new

Amends the Sports Wagering Act. Prohibits a sports wagering licensee from using artificial intelligence to: (1) track the sports wagers of an individual; (2) create an offer or promotion targeting a specific individual; or (3) create a gambling product.

A BILL FOR

AN ACT concerning gaming.

Be it enacted by the People of the State of Illinois, represented in the General Assembly:

Section 5. The Sports Wagering Act is amended by adding Section 25-63 as follows:

(230 ILCS 45/25-63 new)

Sec. 25-63. Artificial intelligence restriction. A sports wagering licensee may not use artificial intelligence to:

(1) track the sports wagers of an individual;

(2) create an offer or promotion targeting a specific individual; or

(3) create a gambling product, such as a microbet.

For the purpose of this Section, "microbet" means a wager placed in an outcome or occurrence within a sporting event which may or may not be related to the ultimate result of the sporting event.
